name: Ancient Burial Sites
window: At the start of the agenda phase
text: Choose 1 player. Exhaust each cultural planet owned by that player.
flavorText: The images depicted a race that Rin had never seen before. Curious. Could it be that this was a race that was exterminated by the Lazax?

name: Assassinate Representative
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: Choose 1 player. That player cannot vote on this agenda.
flavorText: With a sickening crunch of bone and metal, unit.desgn.FLAYESH extracted its stinger from the blood-drenched skull of the Jol-Nar councilor.

name: Bribery
window: After the speaker votes on an agenda
text: Spend any number of trade goods. For each trade good spent, cast 1 additional vote for the outcome on which you voted.
flavorText: We think that this initiative would spell disaster for the galaxy, not just the Creuss. Taivra said, quietly slipping Z'eu an envelope. "Don't you agree?"

name: Bunker
window: At the start of an invasion
text: During this invasion, apply -4 to the result of each Bombardment roll against planets you control.
flavorText: Elder Junn crossed his arms and steadied his breathing. The bombs could not reach them, not this far down. At least, that is what the soldiers had told him.

name: Confusing Legal Text
window: When you are elected as the outcome of an agenda
text: Choose 1 player. That player is the elected player instead.
flavorText: Somehow, even after the Council had adjourned, none of them were any closer to understanding the strange and confusing events of the day.

name: Construction Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, place 1 space dock from your reinforcements on a planet you control.
flavorText: The vote was nearly unanimous. The council would provide funding for the restoration. Ciel was furious.

name: Courageous to the End
window: After 1 of your ships is destroyed during a space combat
text: Roll 2 dice. For each result equal to or greater than that ship's combat value, your opponent must choose and destroy 1 of their ships.
flavorText: Coughing up blood and covered in burns, Havvat collapsed against the rapidly overheating ship core. She smiled. She would be remembered.

name: Cripple Defenses
window: Action
text: Choose 1 planet. Destroy each PDS on that planet. [Note: You can play this on a planet with 0 PDS]
flavorText: Titanic vines burst forth from the ground, wrapping themselves around the system's primary firing cylinder, breaking it free from its moorings, and bringing it crashing down upon the installation below.

name: Diplomacy Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, choose 1 system that contains a planet you control. Each other player places a command token from their reinforcements in that system.
flavorText: Ciel evaluated the other senators. Weak, all of them. This was his game to win.

name: Direct Hit
window: After another player's ship uses Sustain Damage to cancel a hit produced by your units or abilities
text: Destroy that ship.
flavorText: There it was! An opening! Neekuaq gestured wildly, a rare display for one normally quite reserved. "Fire the main battery!"

name: Direct Hit
window: After another player's ship uses Sustain Damage to cancel a hit produced by your units or abilities
text: Destroy that ship.
flavorText: The Loncara Ssodu's main battery flared to life, firing a volley directly into the flickering starboard shield of the Letnev dreadnought.

name: Direct Hit
window: After another player's ship uses Sustain Damage to cancel a hit produced by your units or abilities
text: Destroy that ship.
flavorText: For a moment, it looked as if the dreadnought's shield would hold, but a moment later, the ship began to come apart where the attack had pierced its hull.

name: Direct Hit
window: After another player's ship uses Sustain Damage to cancel a hit produced by your units or abilities
text: Destroy that ship.
flavorText: Neekuaq watched, satisfied, as the ship was wracked by a series of explosions from within, huge armored plates and other debris hurtling off into the darkness.

name: Disable
window: At the start of an invasion in a system that contains 1 or more of your opponents' PDS units
text: Your opponents' PDS units lose Planetary Shield and Space Cannon during this invasion.
flavorText: Ssruu has met their systems and fixed them. Ssruu dropped a handful of ripped wires and broken circuitry on the pedestal before Q'uesh Sish. "He will await his next task aboard his ship."

name: Distinguished Councilor
window: After you cast votes on an outcome of an agenda
text: Cast 5 additional votes for that outcome.
flavorText: Elder Junn was a wonder to behold. He knew the name of every senator, made small talk effortlessly, and commanded attention when he spoke. Magmus hated everything about him.

name: Economic Initiative
window: Action
text: Ready each cultural planet you control. [Note: You can play this even if you control 0 cultural planets.]
flavorText: Large sum of Hacan currency flowed freely into the project, and somehow, defying all logic, the returns were even greater.

name: Emergency Repairs
window: At the start or end of a combat round
text: Repair all of your units that have Sustain Damage in the active system.
flavorText: What do you mean 'It's fine!?' Dahla said, nearly tripping over a damaged bulkhead as the ship rocked from the explosive barrage.

name: Experimental Battlestation
window: After another player moves ships into a system during a tactical action
text: Choose 1 of your space docks that is either in or adjacent to that system. That space dock uses Space Cannon 5 (x3) against ships in the active system.
flavorText: Arm the relay! Mendosa bared his fangs. "The Saar will not submit!"

name: Fighter Prototype
window: At the start of the first round of a space combat
text: Apply +2 to the result of each of your fighters' combat rolls during this combat round.
flavorText: Suffi vaulted excitedly off the prototype's sleek, azure wing, landing effortlessly in its cockpit. "Let's see those damn snakes keep up with us now!"

name: Fire Team
window: After your ground forces make combat rolls during a round of ground combat
text: Reroll any number of your dice.
flavorText: Grinning, Jael spun towards the familiar noise of heavy boots hitting the ground. Backup had arrived.

name: Flank Speed
window: After you activate a system
text: Apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships during this tactical action.
flavorText: Mendosa smirked. "Don't ye fret now, girl. It sounds like ye've got somewhere ta be in a hurry, and it just se happens that I ken get ye there right quick."

name: Flank Speed
window: After you activate a system
text: Apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships during this tactical action.
flavorText: There was a low-pitched hum throughout the station and the gigantic, bulky constructions on the hull spat blue flame. Massive ion thrusters! So this was how the Saar moved the damned things.

name: Flank Speed
window: After you activate a system
text: Apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships during this tactical action.
flavorText: Mendosa grinned at the young Mentak pilot's astonishment. "Mobility-the Clan's greatest strength. Ye'd be amazed at how fast this thing ken go."

name: Flank Speed
window: After you activate a system
text: Apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships during this tactical action.
flavorText: With a sound like thunder and a flash of neon blue light, the thrusters accelerated full bore, nearly knocking Suffi off her feet.

name: Focused Research
window: Action
text: Spend 4 trade goods to research 1 technology
flavorText: Stunned, Rin looked over the data, scarcely able to believe what he was seeing. It was nothing short of a major breakthrough. The Headmaster would be pleased.

name: Frontline Deployment
window: Action
text: Place 3 infantry from your reinforcements on 1 planet you control.
flavorText: The soldiers poured fire on the writhing mass, but as each tendril vaporized, two more took its place. Panic wormed into the troopers' minds; was the creature growing?

name: Ghost Ship
window: Action
text: Place 1 destroyer from your reinforcements in a non-home system that contains a wormhole and does not contain other players' ships.
flavorText: Reports of Creuss vessels sighted in the area had surely been exaggerated. After all, the Creuss had no business this far from the Shaleri passage, and usually kept to themselves.

name: Imperial Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 1 victory point.
flavorText: In a sweeping victory that surprised absolutely no one, the Winnu representative singlehandedly elected himself to oversee the analysis of a recently uncovered Lazax data cache.

name: In The Silence Of Space
window: After you activate a system
text: Choose 1 system. During this tactical action, your ships in the chosen system can move through systems that contain other players' ships.
flavorText: The Barony ships seemed to defy reality, bending light around them at impossible angles - naught but inky-black contours could be seen.

name: Industrial Initiative
window: Action
text: Gain 1 trade good for each industrial planet you control. [Note: This can be played even if you have 0 industrial planets]
flavorText: The Gashlai reactors proved to be extremely effective. With the conversion rate practically doubled, the factories' output was immense.

name: Infiltrate
window: When you gain control of a planet
text: Replace each PDS and space dock that is on that planet with a matching unit from your reinforcements.
flavorText: The 1X had scarcely interfaced with the mainframe before it belonged to them completely.

name: Insubordination
window: Action
text: Remove 1 token from another player's tactic pool and return it to their reinforcements.
flavorText: Kilik had never been particularly good at following orders. It only seemed natural to get paid for exercising that trait, as long as she didn't think to hard about where the money was coming from.

name: Intercept
window: After your opponent declares a retreat during a space combat
text: Your opponent cannot retreat during this round of space combat.
flavorText: The space before the fleeing ship shimmered and warped, revealing the bow of the Y'sia Yssrila bearing down on its position. There would be no escape today.

name: Leadership Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 3 command tokens.
flavorText: Rev's impassioned speech stunned the other councilors. Perhaps there was more to these humans than they had initially thought.

name: Lost Star Chart
window: After you activate a system
text: During this tactical action, systems that contain alpha and beta wormholes are adjacent to each other.
flavorText: The ship's sensors showed that the ancient star-map had somehow led them beyond the Mahact plateau.

name: Lucky Shot
window: Action
text: Destroy 1 dreadnought, cruiser, or destroyer in a system that contains a planet you control. [Note: You cannot destroy your own units.]
flavorText: The missile - an insignificant spark against the darkness - struck the hull of the dreadnought. Moments later, the starboard flank erupted in flames.

name: Maneuvering Jets
window: Before you assign hits produced by another player's Space Cannon roll
text: Cancel 1 hit.
flavorText: Something was wrong. T'esla sensed a flicker of movement on the planet's surface, followed by a faint glint of light. Reflexively, she veered her fighter to the side - an action that saved her life.

name: Maneuvering Jets
window: Before you assign hits produced by another player's Space Cannon roll
text: Cancel 1 hit.
flavorText: The fighter's thrusted boosted her just out of the cannon's firing solution, and a metal slug the size of a building rocketed past her crystalline ship.

name: Maneuvering Jets
window: Before you assign hits produced by another player's Space Cannon roll
text: Cancel 1 hit.
flavorText: T'esla breathed a sigh of relief as the massive slug disappeared into the distance. A touch slower and she would have been annihilated.

name: Maneuvering Jets
window: Before you assign hits produced by another player's Space Cannon roll
text: Cancel 1 hit.
flavorText: The flickering red warning lights on her control panel reflected in her scales as she regained her composure. "Well," she said aloud. "Zat was close."

name: Mining Initiative
window: Action
text: Gain trade goods equal to the resource value of 1 planet you control.
flavorText: To support its voracious war machine, the N'orr empire cracked the planet's crust and began mining its very core.

name: Morale Boost
window: At the start of a combat round
text: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls during this combat round.
flavorText: Harrugh stood before his warriors, searching for the words that would express the pride that swelled within him.

name: Morale Boost
window: At the start of a combat round
text: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls during this combat round.
flavorText: We have done the impossible. I am proud to call you my brothers. My equals. My betters. Harrugh's whiskers bristled with energy as he spoke.

name: Morale Boost
window: At the start of a combat round
text: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls during this combat round.
flavorText: Today we turn these invaders to ash and take back what is ours! Harrugh paused, noting the murmurs of approval rippling through the ranks.

name: Morale Boost
window: At the start of a combat round
text: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls during this combat round.
flavorText: The whispering gradually died down and his warriors watched Harrugh expectantly. Every muscle in his body tensed, and he thrust his gyro-spear skyward. "For Kenara!"

name: Parley
window: After another player commits units to land on a planet you control
text: Return the committed units to the space area.
flavorText: The human admiral returned to his ship, struggling to remember precisely how his meeting with the Collective had gone.

name: Plague
window: Action
text: Choose 1 planet that is controlled by another player. Roll 1 die for each infantry on that planet. For each result of 6 or greater, destroy 1 of those units.
flavorText: The letani dipped a mossy limb beneath the surface of the reservoir, feeling the flow of the particles within, shifting them, changing them into something different. Something dangerous.

name: Political Stability
window: When you would return your strategy card(s) during the status phase
text: Do not return your strategy card(s). You do not choose strategy cards during the next strategy phase.
flavorText: The Winnu councilor breathed a sigh of relief. This opportunity would not be wasted. The peace of the Lazax was within grasp.

name: Politics Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, draw 3 action cards and gain the speaker token.
flavorText: The Dirzuga had managed to negotiate themselves into a position of power amongst the other councilors, all of whom still looked terribly uncomfortable in their presence.

name: Public Disgrace
window: When another player chooses a strategy card during the strategy phase
text: That player must choose a different strategy card instead, if able.
flavorText: In the months that followed the report, the Council was quick to censure the Jol-Nar for their unethical practices.

name: Reactor Meltdown
window: Action
text: Destroy 1 space dock in a non-home system.
flavorText: Flames engulfed the shipyard, a vortex of fire and shrapnel that left nothing untouched.

name: Reparations
window: After another player gains control of a planet you control
text: Exhaust 1 planet that player controls and ready 1 planet you control. [Note: This can be played even if all the opponents planets are exhausted. If any are unexhausted, you must exhaust one though.]
flavorText: Gila oversaw the reconstruction of the Hacan outpost, but neglected to inform the N'orr representative that the damage was not nearly as severe as he was led to believe.

name: Repeal Law
window: Action
text: Discard 1 law from play.
flavorText: Eventually, the N'orr diplomat came to an agreement with Hacan Garrus, and the embargo was repealed. Still, he couldn't shake the feeling that Garrus had gotten the better end of the deal.

name: Rise of a Messiah
window: Action
text: Place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on each planet you control.
flavorText: Harrugh stood atop the dunes, looking down at the thousands of Hacan warriors mustered below. Gathering his strength, he let loose a mighty roar, the will of his people throughout the galaxy echoing forth from within.

name: Sabotage
window: When another player plays an action card other than 'Sabotage'
text: Cancel that action card.
flavorText: Q'uesh Sish tapped her claws impatiently. "You were sssaying?" But the confused Jol-Nar envoy stood silent. It was as if the words had escaped his thoughts entirely.

name: Sabotage
window: When another player plays an action card other than 'Sabotage'
text: Cancel that action card.
flavorText: trjn.desgn.ALIZARIN introduced itself to each data nodes, incorporating them into its platform, expunging any data it deemed a threat to the Virus.

name: Sabotage
window: When another player plays an action card other than 'Sabotage'
text: Cancel that action card.
flavorText: unit.desgn.BEELZEBUL followed the group of men through the winding hallways until they stopped at an intersection. Investigators would later find its cracked oculus at the center of a smoking crater, singed, but still functional.

name: Sabotage
window: When another player plays an action card other than 'Sabotage'
text: Cancel that action card.
flavorText: Unlenn smashed a clenched fist into the bulkhead, green eyes ablaze with rage. The entire plan had been turned on its head. Such incompetence was unfathomable.

name: Salvage
window: After you win a space combat
text: Your opponent gives you all of their commodities.
flavorText: When the Coalition raiders had finally returned to their ships, scarcely a bolt remained to salvage from the destroyed vessel.

name: Shields Holding
window: Before you assign hits to your ships during a space combat
text: Cancel up to 2 hits.
flavorText: T'ro stared unflinching at the incoming barrage through the bridge's observation deck. The shield would hold.

name: Shields Holding
window: Before you assign hits to your ships during a space combat
text: Cancel up to 2 hits.
flavorText: The blast from the enemy's main cannon slammed into the space in front of the warship, splitting into two streams across the bow.

name: Shields Holding
window: Before you assign hits to your ships during a space combat
text: Cancel up to 2 hits.
flavorText: The ship's shields sizzled and sparked but remained active despite the heavy assault.

name: Shields Holding
window: Before you assign hits to your ships during a space combat
text: Cancel up to 2 hits.
flavorText: As the assault died down and it became clear that the ship sustained no major damage, T'ro clicked his mandibles in anticipation. "Return fire!"

name: Signal Jamming
window: Action
text: Choose 1 non-home system that contains or is adjacent to 1 of your ships. Place a command token from another player's reinforcements in that system.
flavorText: Meian was practically aglow, wisps of her ether crackling with delight. It was amazing what could be achieved with a well-timed electromagnetic discharge.

name: Skilled Retreat
window: At the start of a combat round
text: Move all of your ships from the active system into an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships. The space combat ends in a draw. Then, place a command token from your reinforcements in that system.
flavorText: In an instant, the Sol fleet vanished from the Barony's scanners.

name: Skilled Retreat
window: At the start of a combat round
text: Move all of your ships from the active system into an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships. The space combat ends in a draw. Then, place a command token from your reinforcements in that system.
flavorText: The Creuss fleet was gone. No trace remained of their passage.

name: Skilled Retreat
window: At the start of a combat round
text: Move all of your ships from the active system into an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships. The space combat ends in a draw. Then, place a command token from your reinforcements in that system.
flavorText: T'ro gave the order, and the entire fleet withdrew without question.

name: Skilled Retreat
window: At the start of a combat round
text: Move all of your ships from the active system into an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships. The space combat ends in a draw. Then, place a command token from your reinforcements in that system.
flavorText: We have no choice, captain. Ciel looked nervous."We must retreat."

name: Spy
window: Action
text: Choose 1 player. That player gives you 1 random action card from their hand.
flavorText: I'm no spy, Connor said, casually stuffing the data drives into his pack. "Now, how can I get out of here without being seen?"

name: Summit
window: At the start of the strategy phase
text: Gain 2 command tokens.
flavorText: At the end of the twelfth day, Rev returned home from the summit in New Moscow feeling physically exhausted and mentally drained. But she was also satisfied. They had a plan - finally - and it was a good plan.

name: Tactical Bombardment
window: Action
text: Choose 1 system that contains 1 or more of your units that have Bombardment. Exhaust each planet controlled by other players in that system. [Note, this does not have to result in any planets being exhausted]
flavorText: A6's red eyes flickered with activity, and a string of numbers flashed briefly across the screen before he spoke. "Bombardment complete. All enemy installations have been neutralized."

name: Technology Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, research 1 technology.
flavorText: The Council granted the Yin funding to research an effective countermeasure to combat the virus. After all, keeping the Yin occupied with the virus meant killing two birds with one stone.

name: Trade Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 5 trade goods.
flavorText: The Letnev councilor begrudgingly accepted the N'orr's core mining contract, if only so that the "gracious" Hacan senator didn't secure yet another source of income for his clan.

name: Unexpected Action
window: Action
text: Remove 1 of your command tokens from the game board and return it to your reinforcements.
flavorText: M'aban's voice was barely a whisper, cracking as hundreds of flashing lights appeared on her scanner. "We've been tricked."

name: Unstable Planet
window: Action
text: Choose 1 hazardous planet. Exhaust that planet and destroy up to 3 infantry on it. [Note: You can use this on an exhausted planet and still kill the infantry]
flavorText: Another quake shook the planet, and a wave of dirt and rock rose up to swallow the Tekklar legion.

name: Upgrade
window: After you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your ships
text: Replace 1 of your cruisers in that system with 1 dreadnought from your reinforcements.
flavorText: More guns? Connor shook his head. "Not more guns. Let's try something bigger."

name: Uprising
window: Action
text: Exhaust 1 non-home planet controlled by another player. Then gain trade goods equal to its resource value. [Note: You cannot use this on an exhausted planet.]
flavorText: Harrugh leapt down from the ledge, gyro-spear blazing in the sunlight. In front, the L1Z1X began to take notice. Behind his warriors stood at the ready. Win or lose, this would be the end.

name: Veto
window: When an agenda is revealed
text: Discard that agenda and reveal 1 agenda from the top of the deck. Players vote on this agenda instead.
flavorText: Magmus batted the now charred corpse aside with the back of his golden gauntlet. "The Muuat reject your proposal."

name: War Effort
window: Action
text: Place 1 cruiser from your reinforcements in a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.
flavorText: The N'orr may not be the most proficient shipwrights, but the willingness of their citizens to do their part far exceeds that of the other great races.

name: Warfare Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, place 1 dreadnought from your reinforcements in a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.
flavorText: Elder Junn sighed. "Disarmament, it seems, has fallen out of fashion in these dark days."

name: Blitz
window: At the start of an invasion
text: Each of your non-fighter ships in the active system that do not have Bombardment gain Bombardment 6 until the end of the invasion.
flavorText: T-these weren't meant to be used like this. T-this is a t-terrible idea. Tai mumbled, wringing his hands. "Well 'course it is," Dart grinned, slamming his fist down on the release lock. "But we've got about sixty kilotons of 'surprise' and nothing to lose!"

name: Counterstroke
window: After a player activates a system that contains 1 of your command tokens
text: Return that command token to your tactic pool.
flavorText: That's the thing about loyalty -  Viktor mused, turning one of the pieces backward, facing its own side. "It can be bought."

name: Fighter Conscription
window: Action
text: Place 1 fighter from your reinforcements in each system that contains 1 or more of your space docks or units that have capacity. They cannot be placed in systems that contain other players' ships.
flavorText: T'esla grinned as her shimmering vessel lifted off the flight deck - at last, that damned Viscount would experience the superiority of Naalu dogfighting. "Get ready," she hissed into the comms.

name: Forward Supply Base
window: After another player activates a system that contains your units
text: Gain 3 trade goods. Then, choose another player to gain 1 trade good.
flavorText: All eyes turned toward the darkening skies as the only surviving supply truck rolled through the gates. "Get these checked in and send the last shipment to our allies!" Harrugh yelled over the din of the engines.

name: Ghost Squad
window: After a player commits units to land on a planet you control
text: Move any number of ground forces from any planet you control in the active system to any other planet you control in the active system.
flavorText: The L1 advance team was expecting to find the outpost abandoned. What they found - unfortunately for them - was Connor.

name: Hack Election
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: During this agenda, voting begins with the player to the right of the speaker and continues counterclockwise.
flavorText: YOUR [NULL ID] STATELY GAME WILL BE FOR NAUGHT<< [VAR:42687] ORDER WILL ARISE FROM [VAR:89001] CHAOS<< IT IS OUR HAND THAT CONTROLS THE OUTCOME

name: Harness Energy
window: After you activate an anomaly
text: Replenish your commodities.
flavorText: Manipulating the cosmos was a power reserved for the gods. Rowl spat at the ground as his contraption whirred to life. "Not anymore."

name: Impersonation
window: Action
text: Spend 3 influence to draw 1 secret objective.
flavorText: Also, Connor continued, bemused. "Someone just handed me this as I was leaving. I think it was meant for our dear friend Sucaban. We should be able to put it to good use."

name: Insider Information
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: Look at the top card of the agenda deck.
flavorText: M'aban yawned. Another filibuster. Politics could be so flavorless at times. Besides, she already knew how this one was going to turn out. Not well. Not well at all...

name: Master Plan
window: After you perform an action
text: You may perform an additional action this turn.
flavorText: Viktor laced his long fingers with a wicked smile. Unlenn would be proud. The tactician's reputation was well-earned; even pawns could unseat kings.

name: Plagiarize
window: Action
text: Spend 5 influence and choose a non-faction technology owned by 1 of your neighbors. Gain that technology.
flavorText: The Yssaril spies handed over their prize to Connor, who in turn passed it to the Sol engineers with a grim smile. "Now then, boys," he said, one hand on his rifle, "about those loose ends..."

name: Rally
window: After you activate a system that contains another player's ships
text: Place 2 command tokens from your reinforcements in your fleet pool.
flavorText: The Federation advance would not be halted - not today. Claire set her broadcast to play on all open channels. She began, her voice fierce and unwavering "Friends! On this day, our names shall be inscribed in the pages of legend!"

name: Reflective Shielding
window: When one of your ships uses Sustain Damage during combat
text: Produce 2 hits against your opponent's ships in the active system.
flavorText: Prit scrambled up Hesh's shoulder, gleefully clapping as the entropic shielding tore the mercenary cruisers apart.

name: Sanction
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, each player that voted for that outcome returns 1 command token from their fleet supply to their reinforcements.
flavorText: Two can play at this game.

name: Scramble Frequency
window: After another player makes a Bombardment, Space Cannon, or Anti-Fighter Barrage roll
text: That player rerolls all of their dice.
flavorText: I will not accept this from that worthless scum! Feng growled as his enigmatic companion interfaced with the ship's nav suite. The Memoria's position flickered and shifted, and the blast flashed harmlessly by.

name: Solar Flare
window: After you activate a system
text: During this movement, other players cannot use Space Cannon against your ships.
flavorText: Meian braced for combat as the fleet entered the Ordinian system, but there were no Valefar droneships waiting to meet them. The solar flare gambit had succeeded - they were completely undetected.

name: War Machine
window: When 1 or more of your units use Production
text: Apply +4 to the total Production value of your units and reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 1.
flavorText: This would take weeks to replace if you had run it backwards, Varish called as she rotated the massive capacitor bank. "Okay, fire it up."

name: War Machine
window: When 1 or more of your units use Production
text: Apply +4 to the total Production value of your units and reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 1.
flavorText: The station vibrated as the device sputtered to life, emitting a high-pitched buzz to Varish's ears. "Micro-wormholes are cycling at 19 kilohertz," Cole read. "The entropic field tap's stable."

name: War Machine
window: When 1 or more of your units use Production
text: Apply +4 to the total Production value of your units and reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 1.
flavorText: The station's production facilities spooled up to new intensities, lights flaring as the assembly line drones increased their speeds to keep up.

name: War Machine
window: When 1 or more of your units use Production
text: Apply +4 to the total Production value of your units and reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 1.
flavorText: Varish, let the Commanders know they can contact the Tetrarchy. Tell them the fighter squadron assembly will be done ahead of schedule, and under budget.

name: Archaeological Expedition
window: Action
text: Reveal the top 3 cards of an exploration deck that matches a planet you control. gain any relic fragments that you reveal and discard the rest.
flavorText: Hiari pressed the activation flyphs, and the ancient door hissed open. As she stepped into the pitch-black interior of the Mahact tomb, she felt a shiver of anticipation. Perhaps, finally, she would find the Codex.

name: Confounding Legal Text
window: When another player is elected as the outcome of an agenda
text: You are the elected player instead.
flavorText: Unfortunately, Cinnabian said in a level voice, "the Galactic Council requires the dispute be arbitrated by a truly neutral party. As the Titans were still slumbering when your war began, we will oversee your negotiations... instead of your friends on Jord."

name: Coup Detat
window: When another player would perform a strategic action
text: End that player's turn, the strategic action is not resolved and the strategy card is not exhausted.
flavorText: Artuno shoved the slug pistol into Huro's face as armored mercenaries stormed into the office. "I'm afraid the station's undergoing a change in management."

name: Deadly Plot
window: During the agenda phase when an outcome would be resolved
text: If you voted for or predicted another outcome, discard the agenda instead. The agenda is resolved with no effect and it is not replaced. Then, exhaust all of your planets.
flavorText: The hooded envoy erupted into a nightmare of black metal, lunging at the shocked diplomats.

name: Decoy Operation
window: After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your structures
text: Remove up to 2 of your ground forces from the game board and place them on a planet you control in the active system.
flavorText: Enemy fire lashed the abandoned positions on the ridgeline as Trilossa's flock slipped unseen around their flanks.

name: Diplomatic Pressure
window: When an agenda is revealed
text: Choose another player. That player must give you 1 promissory note from their hand.
flavorText: The Arborec emissary leaned close, and Brother Milor flinched at the faint whiff of decay. "You do not understand," Dirzuga Ohao rasped. "You must support this measure."

name: Diplomatic Pressure
window: When an agenda is revealed
text: Choose another player. That player must give you 1 promissory note from their hand.
flavorText: Brother Milor shook his head. "The Brotherhood can not support your war against this extra-dimensional threat." Dirzuga Ohao raised an eyebrow. "Are you certain?"

name: Diplomatic Pressure
window: When an agenda is revealed
text: Choose another player. That player must give you 1 promissory note from their hand.
flavorText: It would be unfortunate, the Arborec Dirzuga said, "if your supplies of diraxium were to dry up. How would your fleet defend you if we stopped supplying its fuel?"

name: Diplomatic Pressure
window: When an agenda is revealed
text: Choose another player. That player must give you 1 promissory note from their hand.
flavorText: Damn you! Brother MIlor hissed. "You leave us no choice but to fight in your war." Dirzuga Ohao smiled, dead skin stretching over her teeth.

name: Divert Funding
window: Action
text: Return a non-unit upgrade, non-faction technology that you own to your technology deck. Then, research another technology.
flavorText: I am sorry, Academician, Arbiter Berekon shrugged. "I am sure psychoarchaeology is an interesting subject, but the supreme leader feels your budget would be better spent on more militaristic research."

name: Exploration Probe
window: Action
text: Explore a frontier token that is in or adjacent to a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.
flavorText: With a dull thud, the probe shot from the cruiser and accelerated into the writhing maelstrom of the gravity rift. Admiral DeLouis paced on the bridge. Hopefully, this time the probe would return.

name: Manipulate Investments
window: At the start of the strategy phase
text: Place a total of 5 trade goods from the supply on strategy cards of your choice. You must place these tokens on at least 3 different cards.
flavorText: But my good fellow, the envoy sputtered. "Surely you can't expect me to agree to those prices!" Durruq leaned in close. "Check again. You may find your goods are trading for less than you think."

name: Nav Suite
window: After you activate a system
text: During the 'Movement' step of this tactical action, ignore the effect of anomalies.
flavorText: The field is too thick! Sikosk gasped. Trrakan's plume flared. "Not for me, and not for Iruth." A flick of his talon, and the destroyer flipped and dove for the asteroid field.

name: Refit Troops
window: Action
text: Choose 1 or 2 of your infantry on the game board. Replace each of those infantry with mechs.
flavorText: Sek'kus leapt from the trenches, the plasma projectors on her Valkyrie exoskeleton howling as they scoured the field ahead of her.

name: Reveal Prototype
window: At the start of a combat
text: Spend 4 resources to research a unit upgrade technology of the same type as 1 of your units that is participating in this combat. [Note: Unless you are Nekro, you still need to meet the pre-reqs of the tech before you can research it.]
flavorText: Varish and Cole completed the final linkages, activating the field harvester. The cruiser's beams roared with renewed power, cutting through the enemy ship.

name: Reverse Engineer
window: After another player discards an action card that has a component action
text: Take that action card from the discard pile.
flavorText: Xuange spread their hands over the captured harvester. Mirroring their careful gestures, dark energy fields unfolded and began delicately disassembling the device.

name: Rout
window: At the start of the 'Announce Retreats' step of space combat, if you are the defender
text: Your opponent must announce a retreat, if able.
flavorText: Vuil'raith fleshships swarmed the weary defenders, sending unease and sweeping through the telepathic links. But Z'eu projected a powerful feeling of calm, and the Naalu fighters began to drive the Cabal back toward the rift.

name: Scuttle
window: Action
text: Choose 1 or 2 of your non-fighter ships on the game board and return them to your reinforcements. Gain trade goods equal to the combined cost of those ships.
flavorText: Rear Admiral Farran saluted as he watched the blasted starship being towed to the scrap yard. "You served me well," he whispered. "Now you can serve the Barony once more."

name: Seize Artifact
window: Action
text: Choose 1 of your neighbors that has 1 or more relic fragments. That player must give you 1 relic fragment of your choice. [Note the neighbor requirement.]
flavorText: Armored dropships crashed into the main dock. Hatches blew open, and Captain Mentarion and her commando raider charged into the facility's heart.

name: Waylay
window: Before you roll dice for Anti-Fighter Barrage
text: Hits from this roll are produced against all ships (not just fighters).
flavorText: The destroyers sprayed fire with their secondary batteries as they advanced. The Mahact dreadnought began to list, fire and atmosphere gushing from a thousand tiny wounds.

name: Adrenaline Shots
window: After you exhaust 1 of your agents
text: Ready that agent or gain 2 commodities.
flavorText: Suffi was exhausted from the haul. After months of casing trade vessels, she had finally found what those pesky Tribesmen had paid so handsomely for. One of her crew handed her a vial from the thousands that had been stashed away inconspicuously. Without hesitation, she drank deeply from it.

name: Ancient Data Archive
window: Before a player draws a card from an exploration deck
text: Look at the top 3 cards of that exploration deck; place 1 of those cards back on top of the deck and discard the rest.
flavorText: Xuange was practically beaming with pleasure, though none would ever know it. Their research had finally paid off - the vault was exactly where they had expected it to be.

name: Ancient Trade Routes
window: After you activate a system that does not contain planets
text: Replenish your commodities. During this turn, you can negotiate transactions with players who are not your neighbor.
flavorText: "Stationmaster," Kier said, fidgeting nervously, "we can't just show up expecting cargo. These routes have been dead for centuries." Artuno smirked, "See to it that they are reinstated, then. The Memoria will accompany you if necessary. The Nomad's coffers will be filled."

name: Annexation
window: After you commit units to land on a non-legendary planet that has a trait
text: Other players must remove their units on that planet from the game board and place them on another planet they control.
flavorText: Those who surrendered were spared and compensated with passage to other worlds. The Hacan's reputation for fairness had won them a bloodless victory.

name: Anti-Gravity Drive
window: After you activate a system
text: Choose 1 system that does not contain planets or anomalies. During this tactical action, you treat that system as if it contains each non-delta wormhole; you may also treat it as if it contains a gravity rift.
flavorText: The Creuss soldiers had appeared in the office despite its field protections. After Rin's third explanation of negative mass and gravity inversion, they still refused to lower their weapons. This technology was akin to sorcery to them, and Rin was a witch.

name: Arms Deal
window: Action
text: Choose 1 of your neighbors and remove 3 of your fighters, cruisers, or destroyers from the game board. For each of those ships, that player may place a matching unit from their reinforcements in any system containing their ships.
flavorText: Ipswitch smirked when the commander asked for the ships' documentation, "Probably burned... with the bodies."

name: Artifact Hunters
window: Action
text: Exhaust and explore 1 planet you control. Each time you gain a relic fragment during this action, explore that planet again.
flavorText: "This is" Dart let out a long whistle. "I can't identify a single part of it. Can you?"

name: Artifact Research
window: Action
text: Purge 1 of your relic fragments and exhaust 1 of your planets that has a technology specialty. Then, research a technology of a type that matches that technology specialty.
flavorText: The observation team had protested with one voice, threatening to report to their respective governments and return with fleets should the Creuss continue to bar them from this discovery.

name: Assassination Attempt
window: Action
text: Choose 1 player and spend up to 3 trade goods. That player must exhaust their agent. Then, for each trade good you spent, they must discard 1 action card.
flavorText: Secret agent waiting, patient, forward deployed to a deep space station, cloaked up with transparasteel plating.

name: Black Market Raid
window: Action
text: Spend 7 resources to gain 1 relic.
flavorText: Carth breathed in the familiar air of Silver Sands. Home. Were it that he never had to leave. Were it that he was not here on such dark business.

name: Brilliant Tactician
window: At the start of your turn
text: You may redistribute any number of your command tokens on your command sheet; otherwise, draw 1 action card.
flavorText: Sometimes the sum of foresight, fortune, and continuous effort coalesce into something greater. In this case, a rare opportunity that may very well change the tides of war.

name: Brutal Occupation
window: After you gain control of a planet
text: Ready that planet and gain 2 commodities.
flavorText: Cabal cultists were known to quell threats of rebellion with stories of their penal colonies on the other side of the rift.

name: Bureaucracy Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, draw 1 secret objective and look at 1 unrevealed public objective.
flavorText: The din of the council chamber faded as the speaker called for order. Today's session would be pivotal - the Keleres proclamation was to be signed into full effect. Qanoj smiled. A new chapter in his career would begin today.

name: Chain Reaction
window: After 1 of your opponent's non-fighter ships is destroyed during a space combat
text: Produce 2 hits against your opponent's ships.
flavorText: Jace smiled at the rookie pilot's disbelief. The ship that the youngster's ordinance connected with had become a deadlier weapon than any their fleet was equipped with.

name: Close Quarters
window: At the start of a combat
text: Apply +3 to the result of each unit's combat rolls during this combat.
flavorText: "Now, now, Unlenn," Evelyn smirked as she hailed the Viscount's heavy cruiser. "Looking to bring history to life, are we?" She gave the signal and the Benthic's railguns whirred to life.

name: Collaborative Planning
window: After another player performs an action
text: They must perform an additional action this turn.
flavorText: Mathis pursed his lips with disdain at the Yssaril informant. "I wish not to rush our plans, only see them done with the correct expedience."

name: Concise Legal Text
window: When an agenda is revealed
text: Players cannot resolve abilities until after this agenda has been resolved.
flavorText: Magmus chuckled at Elder Junn's look of concern. "Let's see you worm your way out of this..."

name: Contradictory Legal Text
window: When an agenda's outcome of "For" or "Against" would be resolved
text: Instead, in the order you choose, resolve both the "For" and "Against" outcomes of that agenda, as if each player had cast 1 vote for each of those outcomes; if it is a law, it remains in play.
flavorText: At the end of the long debate, both sides hurried back to their constituents to spread the news of their triumph. Both sides were booed.

name: Corporate Lobbying
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, each player who voted for the resolved outcome gains 2 trade goods.
flavorText: As he signed the last of the costly trade deals, Mot Nesretep sank back into his chair. It was a gamble with the fate of the galaxy at stake, but his empire was secure. Many would suffer, but that was a sacrifice he was willing to make.

name: Counter-intelligence
window: Action
text: Remove 1 token from another player's strategy pool and return it to their reinforcements.
flavorText: The leaked documents brought a smile to Willard's face. Schemes upon schemes, none of which would ever reach fruition.

name: Custodian Support
window: When you are the first to pass
text: You may immediately score 1 secret objective if you fulfill its requirements; otherwise, draw 1 secret objective.
flavorText: As Elder Qanoj read the Custodians' proclamation, he grew anxious. More support for his enemies, disguised under the pretense of ancient traditions. Others called him paranoid, but his experiences had taught him to discern a shifting of the tides.

name: Cyberwarfare
window: Action
text: Exhaust 1 of another player's planets that has a technology specialty and gain trade goods equal to the resource value of that planet. Then, exhaust 1 technology that player owns.
flavorText: PROTOCOL NOT FOUND >> [VAR:35782] RESISTANCE IS FUTILE << [NULL ID] DEFENSELESS >> ALL YOUR DATA ARE BELONGS TO US

name: Deep Cover Operatives
window: Action
text: Choose 1 player with the most victory points. Look at 1 of their unscored secret objectives, at random.
flavorText: Z'eu closed her eyes and listened for a moment as her guests gasped for air, collapsing one by one as the poison took them. Such is the beauty of the Naalu, she thought.

name: Deep Space Station
window: After you resolve a tactical action in a system that contains your ships and does not contain a planet or a frontier token
text: Place and explore a frontier token in that system.
flavorText: The inhabitants of this forlorn place had long forgotten civilization. Their caches, however, bespoke what they once were.

name: Defectors
window: Action
text: Remove 1 of your neighbor's ships that does not have a capacity value from the game board. Then, place a matching unit from your reinforcements in any system containing your ships.
flavorText: Then she was assimilated by the Letani after all.  Now, you want me to to terminate her. The operative's words struggled to come out, as she refused to process what she was being ordered to do. Whats left of her, said the Hacan, not unkindly.

name: Defense Installation
window: Action
text: Exhaust 1 planet you control. Then, place 1 PDS from your reinforcements on that planet.
flavorText: Tellurian raised their arms high above their head and emitted a strange noise that the locals presumed was joyous. In the near distance, one of its own broke through the earth, shattering the landscape.

name: Defense Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, place up to 2 PDS from your reinforcements on a planet you control.
flavorText: Dust flew from the scroll as it was unraveled before the council. It was a promise of protection, dating to the dawn of the Lazax empire.

name: Deflection Tactics
window: At the start of the strategy phase
text: Choose 1 strategy card. No player may choose that strategy card during this strategy phase, if they have another choice.
flavorText: The old Tribesman's large eyes flickered in the light of the campfire as he spoke. "The greatest form of persuasion lies in coercing another to believe the course of action you wish for them to take was their idea all along."

name: Disrupt Logistics
window: After another player activates a system that contains your units
text: During this tactical action, the maximum number of ships that player can have in the active system is reduced by 1.
flavorText: Communications were jammed. Supply lines were harried. Staffing officers were found dead in their bunks. The grandeur of the scheme shocked the admiral to his core.

name: Early Voting
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: Choose 1 player. That player must immediately vote on this agenda, if able. They cannot vote on this agenda again.
flavorText: Ciel slowly covered his mouth in horror as he realized his mistake. "Damn these galactic time zones!"

name: Emergency Conscription
window: After another player activates your home system
text: Use the Production ability of 1 of your units in your home system.
flavorText: The memory of the war to retake Archon Tau burns in the blood of the Xxcha people. Never again will the Xxcha sacrifice home for peace.

name: Exploration Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, explore up to 3 planets you control; each of those planets must have a different trait.
flavorText: The excitement in the room flared as the representatives of the Naaz-Rokha mentioned the hunt for the Tomb of Emphidia.

name: Fire for Effect
window: At the end of a round of space combat
text: Your units may use their SPACE CANNON abilities against your opponent's ships.
flavorText: Trrakan had stockpiled munitions for this moment. If the reports were correct, and their forces were able to stave off the invasion for long enough, the enemy would find themselves under near continuous fire.

name: Firing Solution
window: At the end of a round of space combat
text: Your units may use their ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE abilities against your opponent's ships.
flavorText: Mirik pounded his fist on his command chair. "We've locked on to the squadron's rendezvous point. Fire! Fire until not but dust remains!"

name: Flawless Strategy
window: After you resolve the primary ability of a strategy card
text: Perform the secondary ability of that strategy card.
flavorText: PROTOCOL SUCCESSFUL >> [NULL ID] FATE SEALED << DEFEAT INEVITABLE >> PEERLESS MANY << INFINITE ONE >> [ID:NIITAKA] << QUEUED1 << QUEUED2 << QUEUED3...

name: Freedom Fighters
window: After you commit units to land on another player's planet that has a trait
text: Spend 2 influence or resources to place 2 infantry from your reinforcements on that planet.
flavorText: Harrugh had brought them supplies, lived among them, honored their traditions, and filled them with hope. On the day that was promised, they would repay him with their determination for liberation.

name: Frontier Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, choose 1 system that contains your ships and does not contain a planet or a frontier token. Then, place and explore a frontier token in that system.
flavorText: Ciel grimaced at the provisions to explore the Ordinian nebula. They must suspect something of value lies hidden there...

name: Fulfillment Protocols
window: After a player activates a system that contains your ships
text: Spend 3 trade goods to place 1 cruiser and 1 destroyer from your reinforcements in the active system.
flavorText: There is an old adage present in nearly every galactic civilization that money cannot buy true happiness, but money could, in fact, buy a new ship. And that made Tai very, very happy indeed.

name: Garner Tribute
window: Action
text: Gain trade goods equal to the influence value of 1 planet you control.
flavorText: Berekar's forte was in leveraging prestige towards economic goals.

name: Grand Heist
window: After you gain control of a planet in another player's home system
text: Choose 1 relic in that player's play area that is not attached to another card. Place that relic in your play area.
flavorText: As her hostages hurled insults, Suffi began to laugh. "This artifact was the property of countless different civilizations. You thought its journey would end with yours?"

name: Graviton Shielding
window: At the start of an invasion
text: During this invasion, each planet you control in the active system gains Planetary Shield, as if it were a unit.
flavorText: Connor scratched his head at the eager scientists. "So, it's sorta like Judo?"

name: Hostile World
window: After another player commits units to land on a planet you control
text: Roll 2 dice. For each result equal to or less than that planet's resource or influence value, that player must choose and destroy 1 of those units.
flavorText: The old soldier interrupted the discussion of N'orr ground tactics with a snort. "It's not the enemy you need to be worried about, lads. It's the god forsaken planet."

name: Illusory Duplication
window: At the start of a space combat
text: Choose 1 of your non-fighter ships in the active system that does not have Sustain Damage; that unit gains Sustain Damage until the end of the combat.
flavorText: "What's wrong with these blasted sensors?" The count slapped his data console, and, with that, it displayed the enemy ship's signature in a thirteenth different location.

name: Impeachment
window: At the end of the strategy phase
text: If the "Politics" strategy card is in another player's play area, you may take it and give that player 1 of your other strategy cards; otherwise, choose 1 player to gain the speaker token.
flavorText: Elder Junn had seen many ruling parties come and go during his long years. This one, he knew, would be gone in the blink of an eye. He'd make sure of it.

name: Intrigue
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: Look at the bottom 2 cards of the agenda deck. Place each card on the top or bottom of the deck in any order. Then, if you did not place either card on top of the deck, draw 1 action card.
flavorText: They had cleverly buried these issues away. Ciel would make sure they saw the light of day.

name: Ixthian Gift
window: After you give a player trade goods, commodities, or relic fragments
text: Commit 1 infantry from your reinforcements to any non-home planet that player controls and resolve a ground combat on that planet.
flavorText: As the last of the containers were lifted into the Barony ship, the Mahact emissary turned to its smug captain, who had been eyeing him, waiting for a reaction to their extortion. He only nodded. The fool would get his response soon enough.

name: Kickbacks
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda and choose 2 different players. If your prediction is correct, those players must each give you 1 promissory note.
flavorText: Gil had remained an emissary to the Civita Planetar. His lifelong career on Mecatol had made him a well-connected individual, with comrades in hundreds of bureaucracies, and favors owed in many more.

name: Last Minute Deliberation
window: Before the "Ready Planets" step of the agenda phase
text: Each player readies up to 2 planets they control. Then, reveal the top card of the agenda deck.
flavorText: The rules for such an occasion were dubious. However, dubious is where Elder Junn thrived.

name: Magen Engineers
window: At the start of a round of ground combat on a planet that contains your units that have Planetary Shield
text: Your opponent cannot make combat rolls during this combat round.
flavorText: Though inscrutable and failing with age, these systems would help to ensure their victory if they could leverage them properly.

name: Micrometeoroid Storm
window: Action
text: Choose 1 system that contains another player's fighters. Roll 1 die for each fighter in that system. For each result of 5 or greater, destroy 1 of those units.
flavorText: The disaster investigation unit could not determine whether it was an act of providence or the beginning stages of an incursion.

name: Overtime
window: Action
text: Spend between 1 and 3 trade goods to ready an equal number of planets you control.
flavorText: The factories reopened without resistance in the end. Was it the generous payments or the Letnev gunships overhead?

name: Political Upheaval
window: At the start of the strategy phase
text: During this strategy phase, strategy card choices start with the speaker and proceed counterclockwise.
flavorText: Ciel stared at the N'orr representative's message, "How the turn tables!", and couldn't help but smirk, despite the circumstances.  Idioms were never their strong point.

name: Production Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, use the Production ability of 1 of your units; the combined cost of the produced units cannot exceed 8 resources.
flavorText: Magmus spoke with a gravelly voice, "In the final moments of their empire, the Lazax wished to see us properly armed against our oppressors. I now invoke this final decree!"

name: Propaganda
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: Exhaust up to 2 of your planets that have a trait. Then, place a number of infantry on each of those planets equal to their influence value.
flavorText: Sara, Blake, and Nolad stepped in front of the camera with a salute as Jace spoke, "They're doing their part. Are you? Join the Mobile Infantry and save the universe. Service guarantees citizenship."

name: Prophecy
window: After a die is rolled
text: Apply +3 or -3 to the result of that roll.
flavorText: "Well, I don't feel any different," Dart said, his eyes blazing with the fire of a thousand dying worlds. "What do you mean 'oh god your eyes'?"

name: Proxy War
window: Before you activate a system
text: During this tactical action, you do not count as having activated a system containing another player's units for the purpose of promissory note ability timings.
flavorText: The sensors of the lead ship exploded with an array of alarms and damage alerts as an entire fleet of unmarked ships poured forth from the wormhole, raining destruction upon the unsuspecting convoy. Reports be damned, these were no mere pirates.

name: Psychological Operations
window: When you perform a strategic action
text: No player may spend a command token to perform the secondary ability of your strategy card during this strategic action.
flavorText: Ssruu did not answer, not even with a change in expression, when asked how he could be certain that the others would forgo pressuring the Custodians.

name: Public Outcry
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: During this agenda, players may not abstain if they are able to cast votes, and those who vote for or predict the correct outcome of this agenda must discard 1 action card; if you discard an action card due to this effect, draw 1 action card.
flavorText: The public was split, and equally outraged. This was a game of cutting one's losses.

name: Rapid Mobilization
window: Action
text: Choose 1 of your units with Production; use that units Production ability, producing only infantry or fighters.
flavorText: Dannel smiled softly. A rare occurrence these days, to be sure. "Glory to the Yin, my brothers. You have done us all proud."

name: Reconstruction
window: Action
text: Reveal the top 3 cards of an exploration deck that matches a planet you control; attach each attachment that you reveal to that planet and discard the rest.
flavorText: The world was far from its former glory, but with proper care, it would become a paradise once more.

name: Recurrence Protocols
window: Action
text: Exhaust 1 of your planets that has a technology specialty and gain trade goods equal to its resource value. Then, ready 1 technology that you own.
flavorText: I48S surveyed the new installation, taking note on several routines he already planned to improve upon. The new processes increased output by nearly 11% - and with a little work, he was sure the enhancers could increase efficiency by another 4%.

name: Rehash Debates
window: At the start of the agenda phase
text: Choose 1 agenda in play or in the discard pile. Players vote on that agenda as if it were just revealed from the agenda deck.
flavorText: Ciel was met by a crowd when he arrived at the Senate Possessional. Apparently his agreement with the Jol-Nar to continue research on the Ixthian artifact had conjured up doomsayers. They would learn the providence of Winnaran wisdom.

name: Relay Connection
window: Action
text: For each of your space docks on the game board, you may produce 1 ship in the system that contains that space dock; each of these ships must be of the same type.
flavorText: His engineers broke into celebration as Umbat called out to praise them, "The forge burns, my soul alight! This is our freedom!"

name: Relic Rider
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 1 relic.
flavorText: The representatives of the ancient civilization sat unmoving, waiting to hear today's deliberations. Their bodies, nearly stone, lent them to such activities. However, these unassuming folk were worth their weight in credits, for their memories stretched to the days of ancient wonders, and their stories flowed to those who would see their will done.

name: Rigged Explosives
window: At the start of a combat round on a planet that contains your PDS
text: For each of those PDS, you may destroy that unit to choose and destroy 1 of your opponent's units.
flavorText: In the distance, a huge explosion illuminated the sky. Brother Milor gripped the rails of his balcony as he watched. These power plants were once bringers of life and light on this world. But now the light will be that of a thousand suns.

name: Risky Jump Piloting
window: After you activate a system
text: Apply +2 to the move value of 1 of your ships during this tactical action. When that ship moves into the active system, roll 1 die. On a result of 1-3, remove that ship from the game board, along with any units it is transporting.
flavorText: They were alive and ahead of schedule, but the captain had no intention of allowing the pilot to "eyeball it" ever again.

name: Safety Overrides
window: After 1 of your mechs is destroyed during a ground combat
text: Produce 2 hits against your opponent's units.
flavorText: In these white-hot flames, the Gashlai knew only ecstasy.

name: Shock and Awe
window: Before you roll dice for Bombardment
text: Choose 1 of your ships with Bombardment in the active system. That ship may roll 2 additional dice.
flavorText: The warnings came too late for the Hylar. When an investigator from the Universities arrived weeks later to survey the carnage, naught was left but smoldering craters. The Gashlai's message was clear.

name: Shock Troops
window: At the start of the first round of a ground combat
text: Roll 1 die for each of up to 2 of your participating ground forces. For each result equal to or greater than that unit's combat value, produce 1 hit against your opponent's units; on a result of 10, produce 1 additional hit.
flavorText: The fury and majesty of G'hom Sek'kus and her Valkyrie broke the enemy. It was clear they were no match for such reckless hate.

name: Short-lived Clone
text: This card has the text ability of each player's agent, even if that agent is exhausted.
flavorText: Commandeering the genetic spinner for the task was arduous and the creature it produced quickly became unpredictable.

name: Shrapnel Turrets
window: Before you roll dice for Anti-Fighter Barrage
text: Each of your non-fighter ships in the active system that do not have Anti-Fighter Barrage gain Anti-Fighter Barrage 9 (x2) until the end of the combat.
flavorText: Mendosa grinned widely. "Ye say we're out of munitions, yet look at all this junk lyin' around. Get it movin' fast enough, and it'll shred them up just fine."

name: Side Project
window: Action
text: Spend 4 influence or resources to research a technology that has no prerequisites.
flavorText: After the meeting, Xander wore a look of endearment. "I swear, Suffi. Where did you even find the time to fund and organize this project? Do you not sleep?"

name: Singularity Charge
window: At the start of the first round of a combat
text: Each unit with Sustain Damage in the active system becomes damaged.
flavorText: In a barely visible flash, their ships' shields dropped. Mendosa growled, "Full throttle evasive maneuvers, the Tribesmen have laid a trap!"

name: Smuggler Routes
window: At the start of the status phase
text: Choose and move 1 of your non-fighter ships to an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships.
flavorText: "From Dirzuga to massive Letani, the whole symphony in every spore. You want infantry? I've got plenty. But who cares? No big deal. I want more... I wanna be where the Mentak are. I wanna see - wanna see 'em raidin'."

name: Space Mines
window: After another player activates a system
text: Choose 1 system that contains your command token. For each ship that moves out of, into, or through that system during this tactical action, roll 1 die; on a result of 1-3, remove that ship from the game board, along with any units it is transporting.
flavorText: Remnants of an age past, this forbidden means of warfare once brought galactic travel to a standstill.

name: Special Considerations
window: After an agenda is revealed
text: Ready up to 3 planets you control. Game effects cannot prevent you from voting on this agenda.
flavorText: "It is our right to determine the future of this artifact," Mathis said calmly, flashing his imperial seal with only a hint of subtlety. "Are we not owed such respect?"

name: Stasis Haul
window: After you activate a system
text: Apply +1 to the capacity value of each of your ships during this tactical action.
flavorText: The cargo ships blasted out of the planet's gravity field. Their destination was weeks away, if not months. For all, it meant the promise of new life. For some, it would mean death.

name: Steal Prototype
window: After you destroy another player's unit
text: If that player owns the unit upgrade technology for that unit, spend 4 resources to gain that unit upgrade technology.
flavorText: The reengineering efforts were surprising. Many of the Hylar ship's advancements could be retrofitted with ease.

name: Stranded Ship
window: Action
text: Place 1 cruiser from your reinforcements in a non-home anomaly that does not contain another player's ships.
flavorText: The Empyrean vessel sat motionless in the expanse of dust, hopelessly lost to the senses of others. Mendosa, however, had a great nose, and an even bigger heart.

name: Technological Breakthrough
window: When or after you research a technology
text: Ready each of your planets that have a technology specialty.
flavorText: The conference erupted in cheers as Doctor Sucaban announced his findings. Countless sacrifices were made to reach these results, but the vast applications made it hard to feel regret.

name: Terraforming Initiative
window: Action
text: Ready up to 2 hazardous planets.
flavorText: Captain Agerro sighed. The work was not what he had expected. Not what he'd wanted. But it had to be done. There would be time for fighting later.

name: Timely Reinforcements
window: At the end of a round of space combat
text: Place 2 fighters from your reinforcements into the active system.
flavorText: Most researchers question how the Naalu's prescience had not led them down a path of debilitating caution. The answer seems to lie in their excessive confidence.

name: Transference Protocol
window: After you activate a system
text: Move all of your ships from the active system into an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships. Then, place a command token from your reinforcements in that system.
flavorText: Jace whistled a sign of admiration at the Admiral's logistical prowess, "They never taught us that at the academy..."

name: Virulent Gas Canisters
window: Before your units use Bombardment or Space Cannon against another player's ground forces
text: Apply +1 to the result of each die roll; hits produced by these rolls cannot be assigned to mechs.
flavorText: Dart and Tai knew the ancient canisters of Exterrix gas would come in handy.

name: Fulfillment Protocols
window: After a player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships:
text: Spend 2 trade goods to place 1 cruiser and 1 destroyer in that system.
flavorText: The Shipwrights were never late, though they had a habit of straining the meaning of just in time fulfillment.

name: Secured Trove
window: ACTION:
text: Purge any 3 of your relic fragments to gain 1 relic.
flavorText: C.O.O. Ranc laughed, packing up the artifacts. Always a pleasure doing business.

name: Free Trade Network
window: ACTION:
text: For each planet trait, if any of your units are adjacent to a planet of that trait which you do not control, you may gain 2 commodities or convert up to 2 of your commodities to trade goods.
flavorText: Celdauri trade ports were a sight to behold, boasting goods from across the known galaxy.

name: Carapace Plating
window: After your opponent produces 1 or more hits during ground combat:
text: Cancel up to 3 of those hits.
flavorText: Phquaiset clicked delightedly as the plating fell away, it was time for a counterattack.

name: Psionic Hammer
window: ACTION:
text: Choose 1 player with the most victory points. Look at up to 1 of their unscored secret objectives, at random.
flavorText: The Cymiaen locked eyes with the diplomat. It didnt move again until the screams had stopped.

name: Shields Holding
window: Before you assign hits to your ships during a space combat:
text: Cancel up to 2 hits.
flavorText: Jgin let out a cold, hard laugh as the attack intensified, enemy munitions rocking the ship but unable to penetrate their hull.

name: Special Session
window: After an agenda is revealed:
text: Each player must vote on this agenda, if able.
flavorText: What is it that you seek? Kadryn asked the Council. You yourselves cannot even say.

name: Diplomatic Pressure
window: When an agenda is revealed:
text: Choose another player; that player must give you 1 promissory note from their hand.
flavorText: There are more pressing matters for the session ahead. The Florzen pulsed. Much more pressing.

name: Freedom Fighters
window: At the start of ground combat:
text: You may roll 1 die for up to 2 of your ground forces on that planet. For each result equal to or greater than that units combat value, produce and assign 1 hit to 1 of your opponents ground forces on that planet.
flavorText: Otto's Outlaws were among the galaxy's most feared guerilla groups.

name: Morale Boost
window: At the start of a combat round:
text: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls during this combat round.
flavorText: Drink deep, be hearty! Tomorrow we die! Ghemina war song

name: Abyssal Starpaths
window: After you activate a system:
text: Choose any 2 systems that do not contain planets; those systems are adjacent to until the end of this tactical action.
flavorText: The calls of the Ghoti all-mother have left many unsuspecting captains lost in the void.

name: Planetary Rigs
window: ACTION:
text: Choose 1 non-home planet you control other than Mecatol Rex. Reveal cards from that planets corresponding exploration deck until you reveal an attachment; attach that attachment to that planet and discard the rest.
flavorText: Gledge dig deep, and certainly greedily, but theyre the best at it.

name: AI Augury
window: When you pass:
text: Return up to 1 of your unscored secret objectives to the secret objective deck, shuffle that deck, and draw 1 secret objective.
flavorText: The predictive algorithms of the Ilyxum are magnificent, but at times infuriatingly cryptic.

name: Direct Hit
window: After another player's ship uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE to cancel a hit produced by your units or abilities:
text: Destroy that ship.
flavorText: Sdallari Tvungovot admired the wreckage as they prepared to leave. They had outdone themselves this time.

name: Aggressive Broker
window: When a player purges a component:
text: Gain 2 trade goods.
flavorText: Kado checked his firearm. Yeah, I know what we did with it, but they dont. They brought the money, lets make this quick.

name: Meditative Firing Cycles
window: At any time:
text: You may use the SPACE CANNON ability of 1 of your units in any system against another players ship in or adjacent to that system.

name: Safety Overrides
window: After a mech you control is destroyed during ground combat:
text: Your opponent must choose and destroy 2 of their own units on that planet.
flavorText: Surrounded by his flaming exosuit, Sir Chulran made one last charge into fire, into death.

name: Contagion
window: After you destroy 1 or more of another players infantry on a planet:
text: Destroy half of that player's infantry on that planet, rounded up.
flavorText: The Soladitys Blight has many strains, some more virulent than others.

name: Remnant Collection
window: ACTION:
text: Purge any number of your relic fragments to draw an equal number of action cards.
flavorText: Vassa Hagi wasnt entirely certain what would happen next, but the relics would be lost forever, and that was enough.

name: Sabotage
window: When another player plays an action card other than Sabotage:
text: Cancel that action card.
flavorText: The best laid plans are Li-Zho plans, but the second-best are those they choose not to interfere with.

name: Hostile World
window: After a player commits ground forces to land on a planet you control:
text: Roll 2 dice. For each result equal to or less than either that planets resource or influence value, choose and destroy up to 1 of those ground forces.
flavorText: Yever fought the Khrask before, lad? The commander cackled over the roar of the dropships engines. Were touching down on a world that wants us dead.

name: Echo Shielding
window: At the start of invasion:
text: Choose 1 of your units in the active system; that unit gains PLANETARY SHIELD until the end of this tactical action.
flavorText: The admiral swore as a shimmering veil spread to envelope the planets critical infrastructure.

name: Illusory Duplication
window: At the start of space combat:
text: Choose 1 of your non-fighter ships in the active system that does not have SUSTAIN DAMAGE; that unit gains SUSTAIN DAMAGE until the end of the combat.
flavorText: Sensors indicated only one Mortheus ship; it remained unclear which of the visible dozen it actually was.

name: Confused Sage
window: After a die is rolled:
text: Apply +3 or -3 to the result before resolving the effects of that roll.
flavorText: No no no. That cant be right the ancient Myko-Mentori sighed, Ah! Yes, now I remember.

name: Singularity Charge
window: At the start of a round of combat:
text: Each unit with SUSTAIN DAMAGE in the active system becomes damaged, if able.
flavorText: Mosk Graezon knew the time had come, if he couldnt have the system, hed take as many down with him as he could.

name: Skilled Retreat
window: At the start of a combat round:
text: Move all of your ships from the active system into an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships; the space combat ends in a draw. Then, place a command token from your reinforcements in that system.
flavorText: Jack Hallard hadnt been captured yet, and today would not be the day he was.

name: Renegotiation
window: After a player resolves the effect of 1 of your faction promissory notes:
text: That player must give you 1 promissory note from their hand, if able.
flavorText: You made a deal with the old government. Rapdr Ironclaw sneered. If you want a deal, comrade, start talking.

name: Forbidden Knowledge
window: When you research a technology that is not a unit upgrade technology:
text: You may ignore 1 of that technologys prerequisites.
flavorText: The Zealots knew many secrets long forgotten.

name: War Machine
window: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION:
text: Apply +4 to the total PRODUCTION value of your units and reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 1.
flavorText: The Mechatronics machinery whirred into a frenzy, assembling a new vessel in record time.

name: Bounty Contracts
window: At the start of the status phase:
text: Choose 1 revealed public objective; during this status phase, when a player scores that objective, gain 1 trade good.
flavorText: Turra closed the case and rose from the table. "It's been a pleasure."

name: Flank Speed
window: After you activate a system:
text: Apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships during this tactical action.
flavorText: "The minimum fee has been paid." The Vaden said. "Don't squander the opportunity."

name: Maneuvering Jets
window: Before you assign hits produced by another player's SPACE CANNON roll:
text: Cancel 1 hit.
flavorText: The Vaylerian cruisers entered the system too fast, overwhelming the planetary defense network.

name: Arbitrage
window: When you pass:
text: Gain 4 commodities; for each commodity you would gain in excess of your commodity value, gain 1 trade good instead.
flavorText: The Sovereigntys Corporations have mastered the art of using money to make money.

name: Micrometeoroid Storm
window: ACTION:
text: Choose 1 system that contains another players ships. Roll 1 die for each fighter in that system. For each result of 6 or greater, destroy 1 of those units.
flavorText: Invaders. Destruction. Pain. The stone churned angrily. Hatred. Judgment. Fear.

name: Professional Archeologists
window: At any time:
text: Look at the top card of each exploration deck, and the relic deck.
flavorText: What they lack in passion, they make up for in well-paid efficiency.

name: Emergency Meeting
window: At the start of the agenda phase:
text: Shuffle all discarded agendas into the agenda deck and look at the top 3 cards of that deck. Place each of those cards on the top or bottom of that deck in any order.
flavorText: Given the palpable Edyn interest, the next council session was sure to be an interesting one.

name: Escape Clause
window: When another player would resolve your Trade Agreement promissory note:
text: You do not give that player your commodities; that player returns your Trade Agreement promissory note.
flavorText: What do you mean? The Vaden smiled, baring rows upon rows of teeth. You read the contract, right?

name: Personnel Writ
window: ACTION:
text: Ready your agent or spend 1 command token from your strategy pool to unlock your commander.
flavorText: "Come," Allant's voice softly carried like distant thunder, "you have been chosen."

name: Preparation
window: ACTION:
text: Draw 1 action card.
flavorText: The choice was an illusion, the game decided from the first move.

name: Classified Weapons
window: Before 1 or more of your units would make a roll for a unit ability:
text: Hits produced by that roll cannot be canceled.
flavorText: Dr. Morden stood still, in awe. Theyre beautiful.
